remarks: Lemma for well-founded recursion.  If ` z ` is ` R ` minimal in ` ( A \ dom F ) ` , then ` C ` is acceptable and thus a subset of ` F ` , but ` dom C ` is bigger than ` dom F ` .  Thus, ` z ` cannot be minimal, so ` ( A \ dom F ) ` must be empty, and (due to ~ wfrlem7 ), ` dom F = A ` .  (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 21-Apr-2011.)
statement:
wfrlem13.1 $e |- R We A $.
wfrlem13.2 $e |- R Se A $.
wfrlem13.3 $e |- F = wrecs ( R , A , G ) $.
wfrlem13.4 $e |- C = ( F u. { <. z , ( G ` ( F |` Pred ( R , A , z ) ) ) >. } ) $.
wfrlem16 $p |- dom F = A $.
$d A z $.
$d F z $.
$d R z $.
